en.value: Which of the following words closely defines <strong>teamwork</strong>?&nbsp;
en.comp:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the most appropriate options from the given ones.

1. Teamwork, a combined effort by people with a common purpose of achieving the same goal is known as teamwork. Teamwork calls for sacrifice from all members of the group so that they can realize their dream in the most efficient manner.

2. The concept of teamwork arises from the basic premise that no human being is perfect. All human beings are special and have some unique talent, skill or attribute. Successful completion of any activity requires a good combination of more than one skill and varied talents.

3. As well as being great for business contexts, teamwork can help families to pull together and resolve their issues - and it is a handy skill for groups of friends who are working together on a school project as well.

4. Teamwork is important in all areas of daily life. Every family is a team consisting of team members of different age groups and genders that are focused on common family goals. At school, at work, in business, and in every area of life, teamwork is mandatory for happiness and success.

5. Teamwork helps different players to learn how to coexist while making sound decisions that ultimately lead to the realization of their common goals and aspirations. Teamwork is a great way to enhance your empathy, communication skills and ability to value and respect others. And, in addition, teamwork is a recipe for success, making projects more time effective and cost-effective, and enabling you to find more creative solutions to problems. Finally, working in a team is a very enjoyable experience. It is something that we can all look back on with fondness - whether because of the friendships that we established with other team members or because of the honour we shared along the way.

6. Hence, it is important that talents and skills from different team members are pooled together, and through their collaboration, a successful outcome is achieved.

en.value: Which of the following closely captures the essence of the passage?&nbsp;
en.comp:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the most appropriate options from the given ones.

1. Teamwork, a combined effort by people with a common purpose of achieving the same goal is known as teamwork. Teamwork calls for sacrifice from all members of the group so that they can realize their dream in the most efficient manner.

2. The concept of teamwork arises from the basic premise that no human being is perfect. All human beings are special and have some unique talent, skill or attribute. Successful completion of any activity requires a good combination of more than one skill and varied talents.

3. As well as being great for business contexts, teamwork can help families to pull together and resolve their issues - and it is a handy skill for groups of friends who are working together on a school project as well.

4. Teamwork is important in all areas of daily life. Every family is a team consisting of team members of different age groups and genders that are focused on common family goals. At school, at work, in business, and in every area of life, teamwork is mandatory for happiness and success.

5. Teamwork helps different players to learn how to coexist while making sound decisions that ultimately lead to the realization of their common goals and aspirations. Teamwork is a great way to enhance your empathy, communication skills and ability to value and respect others. And, in addition, teamwork is a recipe for success, making projects more time effective and cost-effective, and enabling you to find more creative solutions to problems. Finally, working in a team is a very enjoyable experience. It is something that we can all look back on with fondness - whether because of the friendships that we established with other team members or because of the honour we shared along the way.

6. Hence, it is important that talents and skills from different team members are pooled together, and through their collaboration, a successful outcome is achieved.

options.value: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
Get it out of your system.
Birds of a feather flock together.

en.value: The message given by trees is:
en.comp:
Directions: Read the poem given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the most appropriate options from the given ones.

I listen to the trees, and they say:

"Stand tall and yield and be flexible.

Stand alone, and stand together."

I listen to the wind, and it says:

"Breathe. Take care of yourself -

Body, mind, and spirit."

I listen to the sun and it says:

"Nurture others. Spread happiness.

Be aglow. Retreat when it is time."

I listen to the clouds and they say:

"Be creative. Be expressive."

I listen to the sky, and it says:

"Open up. Let go off the boundaries and barriers."

options.value: listen to others very attentively and patiently.
be proud and very firm about your decisions.
keep individuality higher than everything else.
strike a balance between your individuality and take pride in unity.

en.comp:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the most appropriate options from the given ones.

1. Music emanates from Naad which is manifested in the five natural elements - earth, water, fire, air and space/ether. It is also called Brahm Naad, which is the basis of life in the world.

2. Naad is the source of a generation of music which is a dramatic performance with song, musical instruments, and dance. In ancient India, the shlokas of the Vedas used to be sung in melodious tunes while performing religious rites during festivals and specific celebrations. Vedic music or Sama Sangeet or Classical music has to follow rules strictly according to the scriptures. Classical music is a tool for our spiritual empowerment, discipline, brotherhood, dignity and unity.

3. Then, folk songs and folk dances began to be performed in social and family get-togethers for amusement in villages or on occasions like marriage, birthdays and seasonal festivals. Folk music and dance are collectively rendered for entertainment with locally fabricated instruments and ethos.

4. When the mantras of sacred hymns are chanted in unison or devotional songs are sung, vibrations of words and song currents merge into the collective consciousness, purity; peace and harmony permeate the environment and we feel deeply connected to the Supreme Being.

5. The art of music purifies and heals our mind and intellect. This connects our souls to God, and we attain peace and bliss. Sweet melodies produce a positive impact on the aura. This triggers the process of purging the mind of the seeker of negative tendencies and impurities, leading to cheer and joy. Those who suffer from depression get cured. We forget our worries and misery and become happy in the true sense. The experience of music takes one to higher levels of consciousness and one can begin to feel the spiritual resonance within. It inspires one to righteous and virtuous living.

en.value:
<p>What is the essence of the following statement in para 1?</p>

<p>&quot;The fairs and festivals of Ladakh have played a key role to showcase the true Buddhist culture and traditions of this sacred and enchanting land.&quot;&nbsp;</p>
en.comp:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the most appropriate options from the given ones.

1. Ladakh, renowned as India's cold desert is an enchanting place dotted with snow-clad Himalayas, verdant valleys, high passes, peaceful monks and beautiful monasteries. The fairs and festivals of Ladakh have played a key role to showcase the true Buddhist culture, and traditions of this sacred and enchanting land. Hemis Festival is one such prominent festival that attracts people from across the world.

2. The two-day Hemis Festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and pomp all over the Ladakh region. The festival is organized in Hemis Gompa, which is one of the largest and richest Buddhist monasteries in the world. The Buddhist festival is held by the Lama Head to celebrate the birth anniversary of Guru Padmasambhava, the Tibetan Buddhism founder.

3. The Hemis Monastery is situated about 40 km away from Leh. It is a UNESCO world heritage site that is owned by Drukpa Lineage. The monastery is enveloped by majestic mountains that captivate the attention of travelers visiting the monastery. The monastery was primarily founded by the first incarnation of Stagsang Raspa Nawang Gyatso in the year 1630. There are several stupas made up of gold and silver and holy 'thankas' inside the monastery in addition to the copper-gilt statue of the Lord Buddha.

4. Hemis Festival is one of those festivals that reflect the history, tradition and Buddhist culture. One of the prime attractions of the festival is the mask dance performed by the Lamas of the Hemis monastery. The dance illustrates the victory of good over evil. The Lamas dress themselves in dazzlingly patterned brocades and perform the dance around the central flagpole, which is situated in the courtyard of the monastery.

5. The dance movements are typically slow and every mask worn by the Lamas represents certain deities. Some of the dance forms depict the popular Tibetan fables.

options.value: Fairs and festivals of Ladakh go hand-in-hand with Buddhist culture.&nbsp;
Fairs and festivals of Ladakh add fun and frolic to the Buddhist culture.&nbsp;
Buddhist culture is a reflection of fairs and festivals of Ladakh.&nbsp;
Fairs and festivals of Ladakh are an exhibit of Buddhist culture.
